content.raw: This should be changed to support a cmake parameter that is able to look for a urdf system dependency and use that instead of the internal copy.
content.html: This should be changed to support a cmake parameter that is able to look for a urdf system dependency and use that instead of the internal copy.

content.raw:
I have a patch in Fedora's sdformat package that almost does just that.  You may be able to adapt it by adding a USE_EXTERNAL_URDF cmake parameter which controls whether or not the pkg_check_modules(URDF) is called (and HAVE_URDF would be set to OFF otherwise).  This patch also has part of the same kind of logic for detecting/using the system gtest library, if you're interested I can strip that out and submit it as a pull request over the holiday sometime.

http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/sdformat.git/tree/sdformat-1.4.10-urdfdom.patch
content.html:
I have a patch in Fedora's sdformat package that almost does just that. You may be able to adapt it by adding a USE_EXTERNAL_URDF cmake parameter which controls whether or not the pkg_check_modules(URDF) is called (and HAVE_URDF would be set to OFF otherwise). This patch also has part of the same kind of logic for detecting/using the system gtest library, if you're interested I can strip that out and submit it as a pull request over the holiday sometime.

http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/sdformat.git/tree/sdformat-1.4.10-urdfdom.patch

content.raw: Yay! Thanks @rmattes. It is the same that I was proposing here, just I want to force the option instead of responding on presence of the urdf pkgconfig file, so we are sure when building packages that embedded copy is not used. I can do the work based on your patch, if you don't mind, and I wll cc as reviewer.
content.html: Yay! Thanks @rmattes. It is the same that I was proposing here, just I want to force the option instead of responding on presence of the urdf pkgconfig file, so we are sure when building packages that embedded copy is not used. I can do the work based on your patch, if you don't mind, and I wll cc as reviewer.

content.raw: Sounds great, that's fine with me.

I've split out the two patches. The URDF part is in pull request #77 while the gtest part is in branch [use_external_gtest_flag](#!/osrf/sdformat/branch/use_external_gtest_flag). Ubuntu does not provide a binary for google test nor a cmake or pkgconfig finder. I'm supposing that fedora is currently doing that so you can use the ```find_package(GTest)```. It would need a bit more of work to make it able to find debian/ubuntu files and compile them.
content.html: I've split out the two patches. The URDF part is in pull request #77 while the gtest part is in branch use_external_gtest_flag. Ubuntu does not provide a binary for google test nor a cmake or pkgconfig finder. I'm supposing that fedora is currently doing that so you can use the find_package(GTest). It would need a bit more of work to make it able to find debian/ubuntu files and compile them.
